meanings.sent1: She quickly decided to retract her hand from the hot stove.
meanings.sent2: The turtle can retract its head into its shell for protection.
meanings.sent3: In the game of tug-of-war, the team had to retract their rope to avoid losing.
meanings.sent4: The cat can retract its claws like a hidden weapon.
meanings.sent5: The curtains automatically retract when you press the button.

meanings.sent1: He had to retract his offer to lend money due to unexpected expenses.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to retract their product from the market for safety reasons.
meanings.sent3: The magician had to retract the rabbit back into the hat for the next trick.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she needed to retract her words, but it was too late.
meanings.sent5: The bridge can retract to let the ships pass through.

meanings.definition: To disavow or repudiate a statement or belief
meanings.sent1: The politician had to retract his controversial statement after public backlash.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to retract her apology even though she felt pressured to do so.
meanings.sent3: The student had to retract his claim of being an alien from Mars during the debate.
meanings.sent4: The celebrity had to retract her endorsement of the product due to negative reviews.
meanings.sent5: The scientist had to retract his theory after new evidence emerged.
